body.p: What is the physiological process that typically does not apply to nociceptors, making them different from most other somatosensory receptors?

feedback.p: Incorrect. All sensory receptors transduce a stimulus into changes in membrane potential.
Correct. Even with continued stimulation due to tissue damage, some of the nociceptors will not reduce or stop sending signals as long as the damage is present.
Incorrect. Pain can be subdivided into different sub-modality categories, including sharp, dull and aching pain.
Incorrect. Nociceptors are found in most tissues, so they can be used to to detect both somatic and visceral stimuli.

hint.p: Earlier you learned that as long as a painful stimulus is applied, the person continues to “get the message”.
